title: Blaze BBQ Sauce Recipe
transcripts:
[MUSIC PLAYING]

Let's begin by melting some butter in a sauce pan in medium high heat. Add to that some pureed yellow onion and garlic paste. A little fresh cracked black pepper and salt to taste. Now very carefully add some bourbon. We cook this down for 5 to 8 minutes. If it ignites, allow it to flambeau for a few seconds and then blow it out. Put some tomato paste, some dark brown sugar. Wisk this around well to keep the paste form burning add some unsulphured molasses again whisking well, fresh lemon juice, freshly squeezed orange juice, worcestershire sauce, some tomato sauce and again wisk everything around well. Now add some core salt and fresh cracked black pepper ground chipotle powder and some ground cinnamon. Wisk this together and follow with some finely chopped flat leaf parsley and some orange zest. Wisk well bring to a boil for ten to twenty seconds then turn the burner to low add a final splash of bourbon and allow the sauce to lightly simmer for 20-30 minutes to reduce and concentrate the flavors. Turn off the burner and wisk in a little butter to round off the sauce and give it a little extra richness and the sauce is ready to be mopped on whatever you like. Blaze grills, where grilling starts and flavor begins
